quote: You have to think along, I can’t take care of everything.
What I’ve said yesterday doesn’t matter today anymore.
Good morning, my name is Bob, I’m the “Senior Chief Strategist and Vice President of Innovation, Cloud Evangelism, and Operational Leadership”.
Take care of the problem and I’ll take care of the rest.
We need a meeting on this topic.
Don’t go into details, I don’t understand them anyway.
Important things need to be done first.
What’s our current high priority blocker? [yada…] Ok, let’s start with the high priority blocker!
We need this feature implemented by next Monday, let’s work agile!
I didn’t meant it personally, I just don’t like you.
I’m sure, you’ll get the promotion next year.
Don’t waste time creating unit tests, just build working software.
The value of unit tests is overrated and they don’t provide any business value.
This can’t possibly take one day!
We should outsource it to India.
You’re fired. …but don’t take it personally.
Actually I like you a lot but you’re fired.
Actually you’re a good guy but we need to reduce the head count.
You’re very important for our company, you provide CO2 for the plants in the empty office, in the 3rd floor.
You don’t need to write unit tests, I approve this.
Just skip the unit tests.
Nobody pays us for security, so skip it.
It’s only a privacy issue when somebody spots it.
It’s not a data privacy issue when the users don’t know about it.
I don’t like you and you don’t like me but we need to get along until I can fire you.
You can’t make money with data privacy but you can make money with data.
Actually that’s not really a promotion, you just can’t do as much harm in your new role.
You can’t do that because you’re not supposed to do that.
…we don’t need yet another oxygen thief.
I don’t know how to do this, so I delegated it.
I’m your manager but I can’t decide on my own.
That is not enterprise-grade architecture, that’s too simple.
It’s not enterprise when we do not use a multi-tier architecture and persist the data directly instead.
Let’s spend a day to estimate whether we can finish this by the end of this week.
Just ignore the failure notifications from our CI but do not disable them.
The Chief Security Expert said, my password needs to be secure!
The Chief Security Expert said, we should treat private data confidential!
The Chief Security Expert said, we should avoid security issues!
Right now we have more important things to do than to fix bugs!
I didn’t change my mind, it’s just another day today.
We should not leverage microservice architecture, because our services need to scale.
